document.text:
From: 
To: 
Cc: 
Subject: • :  • on ay 
Date: Mon, 16 Sep 2019 13:51:16 +0000 
Totally agree. If you guys are up for handling (or if as able to handle solo), I'd definitely like to use the time in the 
office today before being out for the next few days. But I'm around until noon, so if folks would like me to join, I certainly 
can. 
From: 
Sent: Monday, September 16, 2019 9:50 AM 
To: 
Subject: RE: Monday 
I think this is probably eminently handle-able by one person, unless anybody disagrees?I'm happy to join if 
you'd like, or to just handle, or if you feel like doing it then I'm totally happy to defer (and I'll just continue to prep for 
California interviews). Agree with =that certainly in the first instance it's likely to involve getting a list of names and 
not particularly credibility-heavy, such that we'd want a couple people to be able to weigh in on the info up the chain. 
Thoughts? 
From: 
Sent: Monday, September 16, 2019 09:26 
To: 
Subject: RE: Monday 
Sorry, this got lost in my inbox. No problem at all if you still need to skip this. 
From: 
Sent: Friday, September 13, 2019 4:13 PM 
To: 
Subject: Monday 
Sorry to ask, but is it okay if I don't join you guys for Monday's interview with I'm trying to find time to 
meet with another case team, and it looks like Monday morning would work best for that. 
was Epstein's long-time house manager in NY, but we don't know anything beyond that, so the purpose of the 
interview is really just to identify other employees and see what if anything he saw at the house. 
Assistant United States Attorney 
Southern District of New York 
New York, NY 10007 
EFTA00027953
